newsitem.title: UK: Kwik Save says minimum pay beyond 3.50 stg impacts.
newsitem.headline: Kwik Save says minimum pay beyond 3.50 stg impacts.

text.p: British low cost retailer Kwik Save Group Plc said on Thursday that a minimum wage set by the UK's new Labour government would have to be around 3.50 stg an hour for it not to be impacted.

"A level of 3.50 stg would be the breakover. The average wage for our main staff is 3.70 stg but what about teenagers, evening shifts, trainees?," group finance director Derek Pretty told journalists at a news conference.
He said Kwik Save currently employed 25,000 workers.
The Labour government, which swept to power in a landslide victory on May 1, has committed itself to introducing a minimum wage and signing up to the European Union Social Chapter.
Supermarket group J. Sainsbury Plc said on Wednesday that a minimum wage would have to be over four stg per hour before having any impact. -- London Newsroom +44 171 542 7717
